str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From a comparative of cheir and teino; to be a hand-reacher or voter, i.e. to select or appoint.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.
A fellow traveler. From sun and the base of ekdemeo; a co-absentee from home, i.e. Fellow-traveller.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
This; he, she, it.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Feminine Singular
str2: From diakonos; to be an attendant, i.e. Wait upon (figuratively) teacher; technically, to act as a Christian deacon.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Inclination, readiness, eagerness, willingness, promptness. From prothumos; predisposition, i.e. Alacrity.
